3. djWasabi.generic¶

Generic related functions.

djWasabi.generic.debugLog(debug=False, message=None)[source]¶

Debug message when debug is enabled.

Parameters

  • debug (bool) – If we have debug enabled or not.

  • message (str) – The message we want to print.

Example

>>> import djWasabi
>>> djWasabi.generic.debugLog(debug=True, message="my Message")
my Message
djWasabi.generic.executeCommand(command=None, shell=True, debug=False)[source]¶

Executing a command and returns the output.

Parameters

  • command (str,list) – The command we want to execute.

  • shell (bool) – If we want to make use of a shell

  • debug (bool) – If we have debug enabled or not.

Return type

str

Returns

The complete url to the Github repository

djWasabi.generic.getGithubUrl(owner=None, repository=None)[source]¶

Get the complete URL for the Github repository.

Parameters

  • owner (str) – The name of the owner of the repository.

  • repository (str) – The name of the repository

Return type

str

Returns

The complete url to the Github repository

Example

>>> import djWasabi
>>> print(djWasabi.generic.getGithubUrl(owner="dj-wasabi", repository="dj-wasabi-release")
https://api.github.com/repos/dj-wasabi/dj-wasabi-release
djWasabi.generic.getRepoUrl(owner=None, repository=None)[source]¶

Get the complete URL for the Github repository.

Parameters

  • owner (str) – The name of the owner of the repository.

  • repository (str) – The name of the repository

Return type

str

Returns

The complete url to the Github repository

Example

>>> import djWasabi
>>> print(djWasabi.generic.getRepoUrl(owner="dj-wasabi", repository="dj-wasabi-release")
git@github.com:dj-wasabi/dj-wasabi-release.git
djWasabi.generic.getString(data=None, separater=' ')[source]¶

Debug message when debug is enabled.

Parameters

  • data (str,list) – The value in either str or list.

  • separater (str) – The separater between the words.

Return type

str

Returns

The message in string.

djWasabi.generic.keysExistInDict(element=None, *keys)[source]¶

Check if keys nested exists in element.

Parameters

element (dict) – The dict we want to check.

Return type

bool

Returns

If the keys exist (True) or not (False)

Example

>>> import djWasabi
>>> data = {"name": {"key": {"value": "doc"}}}
>>> print(djWasabi.generic.keysExistInDict(element=data, "name", "key"))
True
djWasabi.generic.makeTempDir()[source]¶

Make a temporary directory.

Return type

str

Returns

The path to the temporary directory.
